intro: Capsella perversa, commonly known as the devil's-bit scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its flowers are blue to purple in color and are arranged in loose clusters, attracting a variety of pollinators. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
